metadata.title: High isolation rate of adenovirus serotype 7 from South Korean military recruits with mild acute respiratory disease

abstract.original_text: Adenovirus is a major cause of acute respiratory disease (ARD) in military recruits. When South Korean military recruits with ARD were surveyed, adenovirus was identified in 122 (61.0%) of the 200 recruits studied. Moreover, all cases of ARD involving adenovirus were caused by serotype 7. observation of the posterior throat and tonsil area using a Eur J Clin Microbiol Infect Dis (2007) 26:481-483

When South Korean military recruits with ARD were surveyed ,
adenovirus was identified in 122 ( 61.0 % ) of the 200 recruits studied .
Moreover , all cases of ARD involving adenovirus were caused by serotype 7 .
